DOC.brief_summary: The primary objective randomize study evaluate safety effectiveness TIGRIS Vascular Stent treatment de novo restenotic atherosclerotic lesion , ≤ 24cm length , superficial femoral proximal popliteal artery ( SFA/PPA ) patient symptomatic peripheral arterial disease ( PAD ) .
DOC.criteria: Rutherford Class 2 4 . Abnormal ankle brachial index ( ABI ≤0.9 ) . At least 21 year age . Reasonable expectation survival least 12 month procedure . Male , infertile female , female practice effective method prevent pregnancy . One de novo restenotic lesion SFA/PPA cumulative length visually estimate ≤24cm Arteries reference vessel diameter 4.0 6.5 mm within SFA/PPA , estimate visually . Angiographic evidence least one patent tibial artery ( < 50 % stenosis angiographically ) . Guidewire successfully traverse lesion treat within true lumen distal vessel . Lesion predilated stent deployment . Prior enrollment study . Vascular access/catheterization target leg within 30 day study enrollment . Prior treatment SFA/PPA target leg stenting bypass . Flowlimiting aortoiliac disease . Additional ipsilateral femoropopliteal tibial disease , outside lesion stented , require intervention . Arterial aneurysm target leg . Comorbid condition would preclude compliance study protocol . Obstructive occlusive nonatherosclerotic disease . Creatinine great 2.5 mg/dl . Amputation metatarsal , result vascular disease , target leg . Septicemia uncontrolled infection . Contraindication anticoagulation antiplatelet therapy , include allergy heparin , history heparin induce thrombocytopenia ( HIT ) , positive platelet factor 4 ( PF4 ) antibody assay . Abnormal platelet level , i.e. , platelet count Baseline le 80,000/microliter . History coagulopathy .
